title: spIBDverse functions and shiny apps
text: goal spIBDerverse give series function apply ERGMs IBD networks.

title: spIBDverse functions and shiny apps
text: can install development version spIBDerverse GitHub :

title: spIBDverse functions and shiny apps
text: fundemental object spIBDerverse package IBD network. create using two TSV files.

title: spIBDverse functions and shiny apps
text: first file IBD file. following headers.
code: #> -  iid1  #> -  iid2  #> -  max_IBD  #> -  sum_IBD>8  #> -  n_IBD>8  #> -  sum_IBD>12  #> -  n_IBD>12  #> -  sum_IBD>16  #> -  n_IBD>16  #> -  sum_IBD>20  #> -  n_IBD>20

title: spIBDverse functions and shiny apps
text: next file needed meta file. can contain meta-data samples, needs two columns: iid sample IDs must entry IDs mentioned iid1 iid2 column IBD file. frac_gp column.

title: spIBDverse functions and shiny apps
text: example files within spIBDerverse package can used example. can obtained convert IBD network
code: ibd_file <- fs::path_package(   "extdata",   "example-ibd-data.tsv",   package = "spIBDerverse" ) meta_file <- fs::path_package(   "extdata",   "example-meta-data.tsv",   package = "spIBDerverse" ) ibd_network <- create_ibd_network(   ibd_file,   meta_file,   ibd_co = c(0, 2, 1, 0),   frac_co = 0.49 ) ibd_network #> IGRAPH 49b8fca UN-- 328 2103 --  #> + attr: name (v/c), frac_gp (v/n), frac_missing (v/n), frac_het (v/n), #> | n_cov_snp (v/n), Archaeological_ID (v/c), Master_ID (v/c), Projects #> | (v/c), Locality (v/c), Province (v/c), Country (v/c), Latitude (v/n), #> | Longitude (v/n), date (v/c), date_type (v/c), imputation_type (v/c), #> | degree (v/n), wij (e/n) #> + edges from 49b8fca (vertex names): #>  [1] KUP007--KUP023 RKC013--RKC029 RKC031--RKF238 RKF195--RKF196 RKC020--RKF142 #>  [6] KFJ018--KFJ017 RKF182--RKF148 RKF142--RKF002 RKF162--RKF118 RKC011--RKC029 #> [11] RKF052--RKF172 KFJ021--KFJ010 KFJ012--KFJ009 RKF143--RKF034 RKF237--RKF136 #> [16] KFJ022--KFJ009 RKF026--RKF027 RKF142--RKF140 RKF254--RKF256 RKF160--RKF047 #> + ... omitted several edges

title: clean model names — clean_models
code: ergms <- example_network |>   get_ergms(c("site", "genetic_sex")) |>   purrr::map(broom::glance) |>   purrr::list_rbind(names_to = "model") #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  clean_models(ergms$model) |> print() #> [1] "edges|NM(site)"                 "edges|NM(genetic_sex)"          #> [3] "edges|NM(site)|NM(genetic_sex)" "edges"

title: create_ibd_network — create_ibd_network
text: ibd_file TSV file IBD data meta_file TSV node metadata ibd_co vector cutoffs defining edge frac_co cutoff quality control - default 0.49

title: create_ibd_network — create_ibd_network
code: ibd_file <- fs::path_package(   "extdata",   "example-ibd-data.tsv",   package = "spIBDerverse" ) meta_file <- fs::path_package(   "extdata",   "example-meta-data.tsv",   package = "spIBDerverse" ) create_ibd_network(   ibd_file,   meta_file,   ibd_co = c(0, 2, 1, 0) ) #> IGRAPH 1d2af30 UN-- 328 1712 --  #> + attr: name (v/c), frac_gp (v/n), frac_missing (v/n), frac_het (v/n), #> | n_cov_snp (v/n), Archaeological_ID (v/c), Master_ID (v/c), Projects #> | (v/c), Locality (v/c), Province (v/c), Country (v/c), Latitude (v/n), #> | Longitude (v/n), date (v/c), date_type (v/c), imputation_type (v/c), #> | degree (v/n), wij (e/n) #> + edges from 1d2af30 (vertex names): #>  [1] KUP007--KUP023 RKC013--RKC029 RKC031--RKF238 RKF195--RKF196 RKC020--RKF142 #>  [6] KFJ018--KFJ017 RKF182--RKF148 RKF142--RKF002 RKF162--RKF118 RKC011--RKC029 #> [11] RKF052--RKF172 KFJ021--KFJ010 KFJ012--KFJ009 RKF143--RKF034 RKF237--RKF136 #> [16] KFJ022--KFJ009 RKF026--RKF027 RKF142--RKF140 RKF254--RKF256 RKF160--RKF047 #> + ... omitted several edges

what: Tabulate the ergm AIC and BIC — get_ergm_bic
title: Tabulate the ergm AIC and BIC — get_ergm_bic
Tabulate the ergm AIC and BIC — get_ergm_bic
Tabulate the ergm AIC and BIC — get_ergm_bic
Tabulate the ergm AIC and BIC — get_ergm_bic
Tabulate the ergm AIC and BIC — get_ergm_bic
code: ergms <- get_ergms(   example_network,   preds = c("site", "genetic_sex") ) #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  ergms |> get_ergm_bic() #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   Model                                                        AIC   BIC #>   <chr>                                                      <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 network ~ edges + nodemix('site') + nodemix('genetic_sex')  467.  504. #> 2 network ~ edges + nodemix('site')                           537.  565. #> 3 network ~ edges + nodemix('genetic_sex')                    578.  592. #> 4 network ~ edges                                             640.  645.

what: Convert ergm coefficients to fold changes — get_ergm_fc
title: Convert ergm coefficients to fold changes — get_ergm_fc
text: fold changes based comparison reference level

title: Convert ergm coefficients to fold changes — get_ergm_fc
Convert ergm coefficients to fold changes — get_ergm_fc
text: ergm ergm fit trim whether remove coefficients coefficient -Inf

title: Convert ergm coefficients to fold changes — get_ergm_fc
Convert ergm coefficients to fold changes — get_ergm_fc
code: ergm <- get_ergms(example_network, preds = "site") #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  get_ergm_fc(ergm[[1]]) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   term          theta   phi #>   <chr>         <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 edges        -1.62  1     #> 2 mix.site.A.B -1.37  0.289 #> 3 mix.site.B.B  0.642 1.65  #> 4 mix.site.A.C -0.868 0.464 #> 5 mix.site.B.C -1.25  0.325 #> 6 mix.site.C.C  1.64  3.07

title: get_ergms — get_ergms
text: Given node attributes network, fits possible ergms

title: get_ergms — get_ergms
text: network igraph object preds vector predictors

title: get_ergms — get_ergms
code: get_ergms(example_network, c("site", "genetic_sex")) #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  #> Starting maximum pseudolikelihood estimation (MPLE): #> Obtaining the responsible dyads. #> Evaluating the predictor and response matrix. #> Maximizing the pseudolikelihood. #> Finished MPLE. #> Evaluating log-likelihood at the estimate.  #>  #> $`network ~ edges + nodemix('site')` #>  #> Call: #> ergm::ergm(formula = stats::as.formula(x)) #>  #> Maximum Likelihood Coefficients: #>        edges  mix.site.A.B  mix.site.B.B  mix.site.A.C  mix.site.B.C   #>      -1.6227       -1.3730        0.6419       -0.8678       -1.2490   #> mix.site.C.C   #>       1.6447   #>  #> $`network ~ edges + nodemix('genetic_sex')` #>  #> Call: #> ergm::ergm(formula = stats::as.formula(x)) #>  #> Maximum Likelihood Coefficients: #>               edges  mix.genetic_sex.F.M  mix.genetic_sex.M.M   #>            -1.11600             -1.92852             -0.06265   #>  #> $`network ~ edges + nodemix('site') + nodemix('genetic_sex')` #>  #> Call: #> ergm::ergm(formula = stats::as.formula(x)) #>  #> Maximum Likelihood Coefficients: #>               edges         mix.site.A.B         mix.site.B.B   #>             -1.0214              -1.5870               0.6982   #>        mix.site.A.C         mix.site.B.C         mix.site.C.C   #>             -0.9532              -1.3154               1.9115   #> mix.genetic_sex.F.M  mix.genetic_sex.M.M   #>             -2.0704               0.3942   #>  #> $`network ~ edges` #>  #> Call: #> ergm::ergm(formula = stats::as.formula(x)) #>  #> Maximum Likelihood Coefficients: #>  edges   #> -1.796   #>

title: Get network summary — get_network_summary
code: get_network_summary(example_network) #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   measure                              value #>   <chr>                                <dbl> #> 1 Number of nodes                         40 #> 2 Number of edges                        111 #> 3 Number of unconnected nodes              0 #> 4 Number of nodes missing: genetic_sex     0 #> 5 Number of nodes missing: site            0 #> 6 Number of nodes missing: lat             0 #> 7 Number of nodes missing: long            0

title: plot ggnet — plot_ggnet
code: plot_ggnet(   ggnet_obj,   fill_col = "",   shape_col = "",   node_size = 4,   text_size = 4,   labels = FALSE,   label_col = "",   label_inc = "",   label_exc = "",   connected = "Show" )

title: plot ggnet — plot_ggnet
text: ggnet_obj ggnetwork dataframe fill_col vertex attribute node fill shape_col vertex attribute node shape node_size node size text_size label size labels add labels label_col vertex attribute use labels label_inc regular expression include labels label_exc regular expression exclude labels connected choice deal isolated nodes

title: plot ggnet — plot_ggnet
code: example_ggnet <- ggnetwork::ggnetwork(example_network) plot_ggnet(example_ggnet) #> Warning: Removed 151 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_text()`).
